entry.title: NEW SAP Activate provisioning road map for SAP Business Suite packages.
entry.content:
Recently, SAP announced the availability of SAP Business Suite packages for customers to explore comprehensive packages tailored to their business and easily extended with modular add-ons. Learn more about the packages here.  

We are excited to announce that a new SAP Activate provisioning road map for Business Suite is now available in the SAP road map Viewer! The new content covers the provisioning process for the Finance and Supply Chain management packages. The Provisioning Enablement for SAP Cloud ERP Activate roadmap provides a step-by-step guide for provisioning and preparing the project systems. It covers the complete process from requesting systems to performing initial configurations, creating users, and ensuring readiness for project execution. 

What is SAP Business Suite:

SAP Business Suite integrates SAP cloud ERP applications, SAP Business AI, and SAP Business Data Cloud to deliver exceptional business value, all powered by the SAP Business Technology Platform. Focused on built-in innovation, AI agents and context-rich data are embedded into SAP's core cloud ERP and line-of-business applications. This unified approach to enterprise management helps organizations scale and succeed more easily than ever before. Read the SAP Business Suite page to learn more.

What's new in SAP Activate: 

Once customer sign a contract, they will receive an onboarding email with instructions on what to do next. The email links to this new roadmap, designed specifically to support Initial System Administrators in setting up their SAP Business Suite systems quickly and efficiently. It provides step-by-step guidance for requesting, receiving, and configuring your systems, ensuring your project teams have the access they need right from the start.

What you’ll get with the new roadmap:

  • A clear sequence of tasks to follow 
  • Helpful guidance and best practices for system provisioning
  • Links to key accelerators, tools, and resources
  • A smooth handover from request to configuration and readiness for project work

How to get started: 

To help you get started, we’ve created a short video that walks you through the roadmap, highlights what’s included, and shows you exactly where to find the content in Roadmap Viewer.

 

Start exploring the new roadmap here and if you are an initial Administrator or project lead, check it out, watch the video intro to get started, follow the steps and share your feedback to help us continuously improve the content. 

How to provide feedback: 

  1. You can provide feedback directly in road map viewer while viewing the content. Refer to my previous blog Providing Feedback in SAP Activate road map viewer.
  2. Send us a direct email via: sapactivate@sap.com
  3. Leave us your comments in the section below.
Thank you for your continued engagement with SAP Activate!

entry.title: 掌握您的数据管理：SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 业务伙伴（Business Partner）重复性检查指南
entry.content:
在当今节奏快速的商业环境中，精准高效管理数据已成为企业的核心需求。对于使用SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition的企业而言，防止业务伙伴数据的重复录入不仅关乎数据完整性，更直接影响运营效率。本文将为您详细讲解一套关键的重复性检查机制，确保您的客户和供应商信息始终唯一、无误。

 

为什么你需要关注这个

重复数据不仅带来管理上的麻烦，还可能引发运营效率降低甚至合规问题。通过确保业务伙伴的每条信息都唯一，从源头降低风险，可以增强记录的可靠性。SAP S/4HANA Cloud提供了简便的流程来实现这一目标，本文将一步步指导你开启这项高效的自动重复检测。

小贴士

- 强烈建议在 Starter 或 TDD 系统中确认规则的效果。
- 定期回顾和优化匹配规则，确保适应业务变化。

 

关键步骤总览

- 下载必需的CBC/SSCUI配置步骤清单以识别所需权限，确认你在系统中具有相应权限
- 从CBC系统中找到配置步骤，进入重复检查配置页面
- 根据业务需要设定规则优先级和筛选条件
- 启用并保存设置，让系统自动执行检查

 

详细操作指南

1. 获取权限

在配置重复性检查之前，参考以下步骤，确保自己拥有足够的权限。
- 登录SAP For Me，在顶部搜索栏中打开“SAP Signavio Process Navigator”。
- 找到“Implementation”标签下的“Accelerators（加速器）”区域，下载“Configuration apps”中的Excel清单（示意图1）。
- 查阅Excel文档，确认所需的CBC/SSCUI ID（如100274）和Business Catalog ID。
- 在系统中打开“Business Catalog”应用，找到相应的“Business Role”，为自己分配相应权限角色（示意图2）。


【示意图1：下载配置清单】 


【示意图2：权限角色分配界面】

 

2. 配置重复检查【操作步骤】

- 进入配置界面：使用CBC/SSCUI ID（如100274）搜索“Configure Matching and Duplication Check”（示意图3）。
- 创建新配置：在“Manage Match Configurations”界面，点击“Add Configuration”按钮（示意图4-5），命名如“T_NUM_D”，描述为“税号重复检查”。


【示意图3：配置搜索界面】 


【示意图4：添加配置按钮】 


【示意图5：新配置填写界面】

- 选择比对字段和匹配规则：例如“Tax Number（税号）”作为关键字段。
- 设定匹配类型：完全匹配、部分匹配或模糊匹配（示意图6）。
- 设定规则优先级和筛选条件：比如优先级：税号 > 业务名称。
- 筛选范围：可以设置只检查特定客户类型或地区。
- 设置为默认规则：确保此规则自动应用于所有新建或更新的业务伙伴。
- 保存配置：确认无误后，点击“Save”完成设置。


【示意图6：选择字段和匹配方式、优先级和筛选配、设为默认规则】

 

验证

为了检验，我们跳转去管理业务伙伴的应用。在创建新的业务伙伴时，如果输入重复的信息，您将看到类似的报错消息。

【示意图7：报错消息示例】

 

附录

SAP当前更推荐使用Fiori应用来管理业务流程。Fiori提供了更现代化、更易于使用的界面，大多数业务功能已经在Fiori中得到增强和优化。不过，为了提供更全面的支持，以下内容展示了如何通过WebGUI进行激活的相关步骤，这可以作为理解旧版流程的参考。

  • 激活重复检查：进入配置界面，使用CBC/SSCUI配置步骤102415以激活税号类别重复检查。在维护税号类别应用中，将需要检查的税号更改为“开”（示意图8）。

【示意图8: 维护税号类别应用】

  • 验证重复检查：接下来，在业务伙伴管理应用中验证税号类别重复检查是否已生效。

【示意图9：进入业务伙伴管理应用】

【示意图10：填写重复的税号信息】

  • 转换信息消息为错误消息：配置步骤CBC/SSCUI 103601可以将重复税编号的消息控制从信息提示改为Error报错（示意图10-11）。

接下来的示例是演示如何将这个检查重复项的info的信息提示改为Error报错信息。通过配置步骤CBC/SSCUI 103601进入更改重复税编号的消息控制的应用。将400的信息改为“E“ Error报错。

【示意图11: 将信息类别400更改为E】

【示意图12: 在维护业务伙伴界面输入重复的税号提示设置错误】

尽管以上WebGUI配置步骤可以帮助理解传统操作，但是对于新项目和实现，建议您优先选择Fiori界面，其更加直观、用户友好且与现代业务需求更契合。

 

参考资料

  • 更多细节和操作指南，欢迎访问SAP Help: (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f86dc2eb1f8b48c880a7607213104b27/4465d6e1485749c691bbb400ba548aa5.html?locale=zh-CN)
  • SAP Note 2886187 - 激活重复检查：https://me.sap.com/notes/2886187/E
  • SAP Note 2886241 - 更改信息消息为错误消息 https://me.sap.com/notes/2886241/E

entry.title: Controlling, Scheduling, and Costing of Production Using Custom Fields in Routing Based on AVC
entry.content:
Business Requirement 

Company X wants to calculate the production cost based on the variant selected when placing an order for a product. 

Before Company X can quote a price to its customer, it would like to know the correct cost to achieve the right profit margin. The cost calculation should occur as soon as the order is received, and well before actual production begins.

Company X applies a multiplier to the standard cost of operations, which varies depending on the product's configuration. They want to execute the process in their SAP Cloud ERP.

Solution at high level
This solution will focus on calculating the production cost based on the configuration and making it visible at the sales order. It doesn't deal with sales order processes as a whole.
The multiplier that Company X uses is created as a custom field (called YY1_price_factor) in Production Routing.

Key Steps in the Solution

  1. Creating Custom Field
  2. Setting Up Configurable Material
  3. Integrating Workcenter Formula
  4. Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics
  5. Executing Business Processes

Creating Custom Fields

Company X uses a custom field, YY1_price_factor, within Production Routing. This field is set up using the Key User Extensibility's Custom Field App, under the Business Context: Manufacturing Bill of Operations Operation. The custom field is crucial for linking production routing operations to sales orders.

a. Choose Add Field in the Custom Fields app.The custom field YY1_price_factor is created for production routing operations.

b. Enable the business scenario Routing to Production Order on Operation Level for the custom field YY1_price_factor.

c. Optional: Enable the GUI in the User Interface tab if you wish to see the fields in the UI.

 

Setting Up Configurable Material

a. Set the configurable material as described. The configurable material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX is associated with class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX of class type 300. Characteristics such as AVC_CR_COUNTERWEIGHT_VXX or AVC_CR_FORKLIFT_VXX are used to execute sales order variant configurations.

b. Select the UsedfVarConfig checkbox.

 

Integrating Workcenter (WKC) Formula 

a. Map the custom field YY1_price_factor to the WKC formula parameter AZMDB1 in the Define Parameters activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities.

For more information, see also Configuration Environment of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

b. Create a WKC formula where the SAP standard parameter SAP_01 is multiplied by ZMDB1 to calculate costs in the Define Formulas for Work Centers activity. In your configuration environment, use the search function to open the configuration activities. 

For more details, see Step-by-Step Guide to Setting Up Custom Fields in Work Center Formula Parameters.

For more details on Work Center Formula, see the blog Controlling and Scheduling the Production Using the Work Center Formula Parameter.

Setting Object Dependency and Characteristics

To utilize YY1_price_factor in object dependency, it is referenced to the characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX. This characteristic is calculated using a procedure in production routing, ensuring accurate cost calculations based on configuration changes.

a. Create characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX using the Manage Characteristics app.

b. Reference the characteristic to the PLPO table with the field name YY1_price_factor_PPO in the Addnl data tab.

c. Assign characteristic AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX to class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX using the  Manage Classes app.

d. Assign the class AVC_CL_COMMON_VXX to the configured material in Manage Product Master Data.

e. Create a global procedure with the characteristics AVC_CR_PRICEFACTOR_VXX in production routing.

f. Maintain dependency with type Procedure.

g. Enter the formula in the Dependency Editor.

Executing Business Processes

Sales Order Impact

When a sales order is created for CM-MLFL-KM-VXX, the calculated cost and profit margin are displayed. Changes in configuration, such as altering the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg, dynamically adjust the costing and profit margin.

a. Set the counterweight to 2,000 kg in Variant Configuration.

The profit margin is calculated for 2,000 kgs. 

This solution focuses on calculating the production cost based on the configuration and displaying it on the sales order. It doesn't deal with sales order processes as a whole. The multiplier that Company X uses is created as a custom field (called YY1_price_factor) in Production Routing.

b. Set the counterweight to 5,000 kgs in Variant Configuration.The profit margin is calculated for 5,000 kgs. 

Production Order Impact

In production orders, the custom field price_factor reflects changes in sales order configurations. For instance, changing the counterweight from 2,000 kg to 5,000 kg adjusts the price_factor from 2 to 5, demonstrating the direct impact of configuration changes on production costs.

a. Search for the material CM-MLFL-KM-VXX in the Manage Material Coverage app.

 

b. Choose Start MRP Run to create a planned order.

c. Convert the planned order to a production order. Once the production order is created, check the User Field price_factor in Operations. For counterweight 2,000 KG, the price_factor is 2.

d. Now, if this counterweight is changed in the sales order variant config to 5,000 KG, and the MRP run happens again to create the production order in the same way as described above. The price_factor changes to 5 as shown below.

By integrating custom fields and formulas, Company X provides a streamlined approach to managing production costs, enhancing visibility and accuracy in sales orders and production processes. This solution empowers businesses to make informed decisions and optimize their operations.

entry.title: SAP Sustainability Control Tower: Q2 2025 Updates & Highlights
entry.content:
In the first half of 2025, global sustainability governance has entered a new phase of scrutiny and recalibration. The EU Omnibus amendments to the CSRD have postponed timelines and reduced the scope of immediate obligations for thousands of companies, temporarily easing the pressure of compliance. However, this regulatory pause has only sharpened the spotlight on data integrity, preparedness, and strategic ESG integration. 

At the same time, investors, regulators, and civil society are intensifying their expectations. Public disclosures are no longer judged on completeness alone—they must be audit-ready, aligned with recognized frameworks like ESRS and EU Taxonomy. Companies are expected to move beyond box-ticking compliance into continuous ESG performance management, proactively steering their sustainability journey. 

SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) is designed precisely for this challenge. It enables organizations to: 

  • Record ESG factors with out-of-the-box integration to SAP systems and trusted third-party sources 
  • Analyze performance across financial, operational, and sustainability dimensions to support informed decisions 
  • Accelerate the transition through auditable, framework-aligned reporting—covering both regulatory and voluntary disclosures, powered by AI 

Building on our momentum from Q1, this quarter's updates focus on strengthening ESRS-aligned metric coverage, deeper analytical flexibility, improved auditability, and tighter alignment with financial structures. 

 

Expansion of SAP-provided metric coverage   

To support organizations on their ESRS compliance journey, SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT) continues to expand its library of SAP-provided metrics aligned with the European Sustainability Reporting Standards. These include both qualitative and quantitative definitions based on EFRAG's implementation guidance. Current metric coverage is available in the SAP Help Portal and detailed in the SAP Community blog, offering transparency and reuse for accelerated implementation.  

 

Looking ahead, we plan to reach approximately 80% coverage of ESRS data points by the end of 2025, including metrics from ESRS 2, S2–S4, G1, and additional quantitative metrics from ESRS Topical Standards. This roadmap aims to enable our customers to progressively adopt SCT content for structured, auditable, and regulation-ready ESG disclosures while maintaining flexibility to extend for sector-specific or company-specific needs. 

 

Analyze ESG Data App Enhancements 

The Analyze ESG Data application now offers a significantly improved analytics experience with the introduction of the Analytics tab. Users can explore all standard custom quantitative metrics in greater depth by applying drill-down dimensions, choosing between chart or table formats, and configuring default views tailored to reporting needs. This new flexibility allows up to three charts to be displayed simultaneously, each with independent metric, period, and structure settings. 

In parallel, users can manage and switch between saved configurations of grouped metric tiles (“Overviews”), enabling different perspectives for different stakeholders or strategic priorities. Together, these enhancements empower users to personalize and streamline how ESG data is analyzed, viewed, and shared – supporting more informed decision-making and stronger alignment with sustainability goals. Find full details here: Using the Analyze ESG Data Application.

 

Custom Templates for “Generate ESG Reports with AI” App 

The Generate ESG Reports with AI app now offers greater flexibility and control through the introduction of custom templates. Users can create or edit templates to tailor the structure and content of ESG reports using available SAP-provided quantitative metrics.  

Within the Templates section, you can now select “Create” to build a new template or modify an existing one by adding sections and subsections, defining narrative text, and selecting from a predefined list of charts and tables. For each component, a content preview is available to ensure alignment with the selected reporting period. Once finalized, templates can be saved and reused, enabling consistent and structured ESG reporting across time periods.  

When generating a report, you can preview or download the result as a PDF—and for added customization, you can edit any section manually. SAP's built-in AI-assistance now supports dynamic revisions: simply select a passage and use the “Revise” option to receive suggestions to shorten or lengthen the text, helping refine your final ESG narrative with ease and speed. 

 

Fiscal Period Support 

The new Manage Fiscal Year Variants app brings flexible fiscal period support to SAP Sustainability Control Tower, allowing customers to define and activate custom fiscal year variants that align with their internal planning cycles. Whether using standard calendar months or granular date-based periods (like semi-monthly ranges), organizations can now tailor their ESG data analysis and reporting across key apps such as Analyze ESG Data, Manage GHG Data, and View Emission Dashboard. Built-in validation checks help ensure data compatibility, with options to consolidate or reimport data when switching to a new variant. This enables more accurate reporting, tighter alignment with financial periods, and greater control over how sustainability data is structured and interpreted across the organization. 

 

Change log updates 

In Q2, we've significantly improved transparency and traceability across SAP Sustainability Control Tower (SCT). Users can now track create, update, and delete changes to public overview configurations in the Analyze ESG Data app using the View Change Logs app. This functionality extends further, providing detailed logs for changes in business activity data, clearly showing the number of updated or imported records and distinguishing between actual and target data. 

 

New Languages Supported 

To better serve global enterprises, SAP SCT now supports Turkish and Italian languages. This update enables local teams to work in their native languages and enhances cross-regional collaboration on sustainability data collection and reporting. 

 

H2 2025 Roadmap Updates 

Looking ahead, we’re focused on simplifying and harmonizing ESG data consumption and reporting. A key milestone will be the delivery of a unified Read API for metric values – supporting both quantitative and qualitative data – to  make calculated ESG metrics easily accessible to external tools like disclosure management platforms. This API will also expose key metadata (including ESG standard references) and allow for both bulk and individual metric retrieval based on reporting scopes. We’re also working on improving flexibility in data modeling by enabling custom account groups, account-to-group mappings, and supporting activity data input through multiple channels. Additionally, we’ll continue expanding metric-level analysis, measure drilldowns, and export formats in the Analyze ESG data application. To enhance data quality and reporting alignment, we’re introducing tools for guiding data requirements based on double materiality, setting up reporting hierarchies and data sources, and improving transparency on data completeness. In parallel, we aim to deliver ESRS-aligned metric definitions that cover up to 70% of EFRAG's guidance, along with clear documentation and community updates to keep you informed as mentioned above. Stay tuned: SCT Roadmap Explorer. 

 

Additional Information 

For in-depth details on SAP Sustainability Control Tower, we recommend browsing the SAP Help Portal. For an overview of all new features and functions, check the What’s New section, which is updated with every new software release.

entry.title: Transforming User Experience: SAP Fiori Launchpad adopts the latest SAP Design System updates
entry.content:
Overview

The SAP Fiori launchpad now incorporates the latest SAP Design System, bringing improvements to the shell bar and navigation area, user menu and notifications. These enhancements are designed to unify and streamline the user experience, ensuring the interface is more intuitive and consistent across SAP's portfolio, in alignment with our Suite First strategy.

 

Feature release outlook

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

This feature is available with 2508. Parts of it will be offered as opt-in (refer to the  SAP KBA and SAP Note).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP BTP ABAP Environment

This feature is available with 2508 (only when spaces and pages are enabled).

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

  • SAP Integrated Business Planning

This feature is available with 2508.

For further information refer to the official documentation here.

 

Key Highlights

Shell Bar 

A key update is the repositioning of the navigation menu. It is now prominently located at the top of the shell bar, enabling users to access the navigation menu swiftly and efficiently.

Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu was designed to support the personalization of spaces.
  • After: The functionality has been enhanced, and the navigation menu now offers seamless access to navigation.

Additionally, for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud and SAP BTP ABAP environment the shell bar now supports displaying the product name alongside the company or brand logo. Administrators can manage and translate the product name using the WINDOW_TITLE_EXTENSION parameter located in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, e.g. refer to Manage Launchpad Settings | SAP Help Portal for SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Before and After:

  • Before: The product name could not be included in the shell bar.
  • After: The product name is now configurable and can be displayed in the shell bar next to the company or brand logo. Likewise, the browser window title, the product name next to the logo and the app title are now synchronized. 

                                                                                                   

 

Navigation menu

 

 

The navigation can now be accessed using the navigation menu. If the My Home space is configured, you will see the Favorites Apps section .(For SAP S/4HANA My Home space is in sync with the Favorites). Following this, you'll find the My Spaces section. In this section, you can view all your personalized spaces and pages.

If the SPACES_NAVIGATION_BAR_PERSONALIZATION setting is enabled in the Manage Launchpad Settings app, you'll see the All Spaces option, which allows for personalization of spaces (pinning and unpinning spaces).

 Before and After:

  • Before: The navigation menu had a different position in the shell bar, providing options for personalizing spaces.
  • After: The most significant advantage of the navigation is that it allows you to directly access entries from within any application, eliminating the need to return to the home page first.

User Menu

The user menu has been updated from a simple popover with a list to a more visually appealing design. The entries have been reordered according to new UXC guidelines, placing ‘Settings’ at the top. The menu now can display an avatar, user's ID or the e-mail address depending on configuration options in the different products or platforms. Previously, the sign-out option was a standard list item located at the end of the list. It has now been relocated to the footer of the user menu.

Before and After:

  • Before: The user menu previously was a basic list items menu.
  • After: The user menu has been redesigned to provide a more intuitive user experience.

Notifications

 

Earlier, notifications could be grouped by Date, Type, and Priority. Considering recent usage data that indicated minimal use of the "By Type" option, the UI has been simplified by eliminating this grouping. Notifications can now be sorted using a sort of button, with options to arrange them by date or by importance.

Moreover, while in the notifications view, users can easily navigate to notification settings in the user menu by using the Settings icon in the upper-right corner.

Before and After:

  • Before: Previously, notifications were grouped by Date, Type, or Priority.
  • After: Notifications are now organized by date or importance, with direct access to settings via the Settings  icon.

Conclusion

With the adoption of the latest SAP Design System we strive to empower users to navigate and use SAP applications with greater ease and efficiency.

entry.title: Transport Management in SAP Cloud ERP 3SL Architecture During Upgrades
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP Cloud ERP's 3-system landscape (3SL) architecture, transport management becomes particularly complex during release upgrades. This Blogpost provides comprehensive guidance on managing transports when systems are at different release levels, addressing common challenges and best practices.

Understanding the 3SL Upgrade Timeline

In the standard three-system landscape, the test system is upgraded three weeks before the development and production systems during each release cycle. This approach provides sufficient time for regression testing before upgrading the remaining systems

Transport Types in SAP Cloud ERP

Before examining specific scenarios, it's essential to understand the three primary transport types:

  •  Customizing Transports: Generated because of Configuration changes via Central Business Configuration or Implementation activities Application.
  •  Developer Extensibility Transports: Created when any kind of ABAP developers extensions created generally via ABAP development tool.
  •  Key User Extensibility Transports: Created as a result of Key user extensions for example Custom field and logic, Custom business objects etc.

Transport Management Scenarios

Scenario 1: Uniform Release Level (N-N-N)

When development, test, and production systems operate at the same release level, transport management follows the standard process:

  • Export all transport types from the development system
  • Import transports into the test system
  • Forward transports to the production system
  • Complete the process by importing into the production system

Scenario 2: Mixed Release Levels (N-N+1-N)

This scenario occurs during the upgrade window when the test system operates at a higher release level than development and production systems.

For Customizing and Developer Extensibility Transports

The standard transport process from Scenario 1 remains applicable.

For Key User Extensibility Transports

Certain objects face import restrictions into higher release systems. For example, SAP Fiori Launchpad Pages (UIPC) during 2502 release (reference: 3560509 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 in a 3-system landscape: Release Restriction Note - SAP for Me).

Transports which contain these kinds of objects are shown as outdated. And we have two options for managing them:

Option A: Forward Without Import

Forward the transport from the test system without importing it, and then import it into the productive system

Option B: Re-export After Alignment

After all systems have been upgraded to the same level, you have to re-export the same content again from the development system and transport to test and production system, so as to ensure that the key user extensibility is also in the test system.

Thank you for reading this blog post, hopefully, the blog post was informative and helped you to understand in detail how to manage Transports during upgrade.

Note: You can't import a transport created on release n into release n+2 and higher, which means that you have to recreate the transport in the development system. However, it is not possible to recreate CBC transports. In this case, you have to create a support incident.

Note: To identify the objects not supported for N,N+1 Transports For 2508 Release, Please read the Release Note that generally released 2 Weeks before the T system upgrade.

entry.title: Settlement of Investment Projects in SAP Cloud ERP
entry.content:
What is Project Settlement?

Settlement is the process of transferring costs incurred on a project to a final receiver such as:

  • an asset under construction
  • a completed fixed asset
  • or a cost object (e.g. cost center)

In the context of capital investment projects, this ensures the capital expenditures (CapEx) are properly posted to the balance sheet instead of the P&L.

To start with a simplified view, we can split the complete process into two parts:

Asset Creation Phase

  • settlement moves costs from the investment project to asset(s) under construction

  • this can be done via periodic settlement at the close of the period or event-based with every posting to the investment project

Final Asset available to be used

  • settlement moves balance sheet values from asset(s) under construction to final asset 
    values that cannot be capitalised can be moved to other cost objects, e.g. cost centers

  • this is done via periodic settlement at the close of the period

 

Master Data Involved

Investment Projects are used primarily for planning and monitoring capital investments that are not capitalised directly, due to their scope or the large percentage of in-house production involved.

  • All expenditures related to the investment project are tracked separately to differentiate them from regular operational costs.
    This can include materials, labor, and overheads.
  • The account assignment object for actual posting is always the investment project/ WBS element.
  • Investment projects are relevant for asset accounting this is why they have an asset under construction (AuC) assigned.

Assets Under Construction refer to the work-in-progress phase where a company is finalising the development or acquisition of long-term assets (like a building or a piece of machinery).

  • Costs related to the asset under construction are recorded in an asset under construction/ capital work-in-process account on the balance sheet. This account accumulates all expenditures until the asset is ready for its intended use.
  • The asset under construction is included in the asset history sheet and keeps detailed records of all costs related to investment projects for audit and regulatory purposes.
  • Once the construction is completed and the asset is ready for use, the total accumulated costs in the asset under construction account are transferred to the appropriate fixed asset account on the balance sheet.

 

Lifecycle of the Investment Project

SAP provides standard capabilities to manage the entire lifecycle of an investment project:

  1. Project Creation
    initiated via the app Project Control - Enterprise Projects
  2. Cost Collection
    Costs from procurement, time recording, and service are collected on the investment project WBS (work breakdown structure) elements
  3. Asset Under Construction (AuC) Creation
    Automatically created when the project is released. Make sure you are using the project profile Investment Project.
  4. Periodic or Event-Based Settlement
    Periodic jobs can be scheduled via the app Schedule Overhead Accounting Jobs. For processing of single investment projects, you can use Run Settlement – Actual.
    With release CE2508 a new functionality Event-based Settlement to AuC is available. Using event-based settlement makes the periodic settlement process obsolete as all costs are settled immediately when posted to the investment project.
  5. Final Settlement and Asset Capitalisation
    Upon project completion, costs are settled to the final fixed asset. Costs that cannot be capitalised can be settled to other cost objects (e.g. cost centers).

 

How Project Settlement Works

1. Settlement to Asset under Construction (AuC)
  • periodic settlement: with the first settlement the rule to AuC gets automatically created (settlement type AUC)
    PRE rules can be used to make sure non-capitalisable costs are not posted to the AuC.
  • event-based settlement: 100% of the costs will be settled to AuC, rules for preliminary settlement (PRE rules) are not supported, no AUC settlement rule is needed.
    Event-based settlement is a new functionality made available with CE2508. It can be activated in the investment profile (for details on configuration see dedicated chapter).

2. Settlement to Final Asset

When the project is completed and the asset can be used, the AuC is cleared and costs are capitalised to the final asset.

  • The status of the investment project will be changed to technically completed. With this status the system carries out full settlement (distribution rules of type “full settlement” are used)
  • in the event-based scenario the final settlement will post to final receiver per line item, enabling the feature “list of origins reporting” for the AuC and the final asset
  • the processing type “partial capitalisation” can be used for a partial settlement to fixed asset/ other cost object, before the investment project is technically completed.

 

Settlement Rules

Define the receivers which could be AuC, final asset, or other cost objects.
Rules can be defined as percentages/ equivalences or amounts. Each rule comes with a validity period.

  • Full Settlement (FUL)
    • all costs posted to the sender, also costs in prior periods are settled
    • ensures a balance of zero even if late postings to prior period occur
    • these rules are used for final settlements to the fixed asset,
      or they can be used for partial capitalisation if values shall be moved out of the asset under construction before the asset is finished
  • Preliminary Settlement (PRE)
    PRE rules are used during settlement to AuC (preliminary settlement), if part of the costs shall not be activated on AuC
    > not available with event-based settlement
  • Settlement to AuC (AUC)
    with periodic settlement these rules are automatically created with the first settlement, the receiver is the AuC

Examples for different settlement/ distribution rules:

line 1 shows a rule for settlement from AuC to cost object that can be used with processing type “Partial Capitalisation”
such rules need to be valid for one period only (from/to = identical)

line 2 +3 show rules for settlement to fixed asset (final settlement)

line 4 shows a rule for settlement to AuC (preliminary settlement)
> not supported with event-based settlement

 

Period End Closing - Settlement Run

 

Event Based Settlement (new CE2508)

 

Ledger Specific Settlement Rules

  •  Ledger-Specific Settlement                                                 
    • values to be settled will be calculated per ledger 
    • always active in SAP Cloud ERP  
  • Ledger-Specific Settlement Rules
    • settlement rules can be defined per ledger
    • optional, needs to be activated in settlement profile

Possible Use Case
Settlements to assets under construction/ final asset shall be done according to different GAAPs, e.g. German GAAP defines that 70% of construction costs can be activated while US-GAAP allows for activation of 80% of construction costs.

 

Key Configuration Elements

  • Project Profile
    Project profiles are pre-delivered in the public cloud edition and cannot be configured. make sure you are using profile Investment Project to enable the integration to asset management
  • Settlement Profile
    Determines whether the settlement is allowed and to which receiver type.
  • Asset Class & Number Ranges
    Defines the type of asset created (e.g. building, machinery).
  • Investment Profile
    Used to configure the asset class for the asset under construction. You can also define if you want to have just one AuC created per WBS element, or if you need several AuC for one WBS element.
    The option for event-based settlement is also activated in the investment profile.

 

Benefits of Project Settlement in SAP Cloud ERP

  • Transparency: Clearly track investment costs and their capitalisation status
  • Automation: Reduce manual tasks with predefined rules and scheduled jobs
  • Compliance: Aligns with IFRS and local GAAP requirements
  • Audit Readiness: Comprehensive documentation of all postings and asset movements

Additional Benefits with Event-Based Settlements

  • Transparency: with event-based settlement postings are moved line item by line item throughout the complete settlement process from the project to the AuC and to the final asset.
  • Automation: as the first settlement step “Project 2 AuC” is done event-based, no manual interaction or job scheduling is needed any longer
  • Compliance: the line item details will still be available for the final asset. With this level of detail it is very easy to explain the asset value as for each posting can navigated back to the initial project posting. This kind of reporting is even available without using line item settlement.

 

Additional Information

What’s New: Event-Based Settlement of Investment Projects and Assets Under Construction

SAP Help

  • Asset Accounting: Assets Under Construction: Management and Settlement
  • Asset Accounting: Event-Based Settlement
  • Overhead Accounting: Settlement of Investment Projects

entry.title: Display Changes to Objects
entry.content:
This is a new analytical application in Business Event Logging. It lets you review the recorded field changes for an object.

Screen Areas

Information filter

You can use the information filter at the top of the screen to select which data is displayed in the chart and table. This allows you to view recorded field changes for objects in various ways. You must enter the Object and Time Interval, as they are mandatory filters. Additionally, you can use other filters, such as "Object Component" and "Changed By", among others.

Fig. 2: Filter bar

Visual filter

Visual filter provides a graphical interface for interacting with and filtering your data. It allows you to view and filter the frequency of Changes to Fields based on "Change Type", "Year and Calendar Week" as well as by "Object Component" such as Item or Schedule Line.

Fig. 3: Visual filter bar

Bar chart

The bar chart offers a concise overview of the frequency of specific change fields. By selecting a bar, you can filter the entries in the table. Additionally, utilize the View By filter to explore different dimensional data. You also have the option to change the chart type from the default bar chart for other kinds of charts.

Fig. 4: Bar chart in Hybrid view

Fig. 5: Bar chart in Chart-only view

The "Hybrid view," also referred to as "Chart and Table View," is the default setting that displays both the chart and the table simultaneously. Additionally, you have the option to toggle between "Chart-only view" and "Table-only view" within the chart area.

Fig. 6: Toolbar in chart area

Table

The table located at the bottom of the screen provides additional details regarding the logged changes to objects, including Change Field, Change Type, Object IDs, Changed By, Old Value, and New Value. In the "Settings" button, you have the option to customize the displayed columns to include information such as Object Keys, Activity ID, Source of Data, and more. Additionally, you can utilize the "Group By" and "Sort by" features for the columns.

Fig. 7: Table in Table-only view

Upon clicking on column "Object IDs" you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Events by Business Object".

Fig. 8: Details page of Display Business Events by Business Object

Upon clicking on each row in the "Change Type" column, you are directly directed to the event details page (Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs"),  or a dialog popover appears, displaying concise event information.

Fig. 9: Event Type and Versions in a Dialog

Upon selecting a table entry, you will be directed to the details page of the Fiori app "Display Business Event Logs".

Fig. 10: Details page of Display Business Event Logs

Release Information

ProductAvailability
SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Public Edition2502 and later
SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, Private Edition2025 FPS0 and later
SAP S/4 HANA (On-Premise)2025 FPS0 and later
SAP BTP,  ABAP Environment 2411

entry.title: Staff your SAP Cloud ERP Enterprise Projects with the right Employees
entry.content:
Effective project and resource management is crucial for companies to deliver successful projects. Organizations running Enterprise Projects and/or Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP have the possibility to leverage SAP Project and Resource Management to optimize the project success. Resource Management is a process which spans normally over the complete lifetime of a project, starting with the initial finding and assignment of people, doing the continuous staffing forecasts and handling conflicts like substituting people. This blog provides an overview of how SAP Project and Resource Management facilitates these different staffing capabilities during the project life cycle of Enterprise Projects in SAP Cloud ERP.

Introduction:

Enterprise projects in SAP Cloud ERP   can be used to manage different kinds of projects in different industries. Examples are:

    • Overhead projects: for example, administrative projects or projects for research and development,
    • Investment projects: for example, projects to develop or maintain physical assets,
    • Projects with revenue: for example, engineer-to-order projects,
    • Statistical projects: can be used for certain reporting needs, without carry actual costs itself

Details about the different Project Types are documented in the following blog:
The two project control possibilities in SAP S/4HA... - SAP Community

 

Optimizing Resource Allocation:

Even in a simple project scenario, where an enterprise project merely serves as a cost collector without a formal project structure, managing resources is still required. Team members can log hours against the project, so optimizing resource allocation is crucial. To do this, you need clear visibility of available and skilled resources

Resource Management capability of SAP Project and Resource Management covers the following key aspects:

  • Transparency: Overview of projects people are working on and identification of conflicts
  • Reduce time to staff for Projects:
    • Staffing: Find available and skilled people and staff persons as requested and consider their availability
    • AI-assisted skill matching: overcome challenges like outdated employee profiles and reviewing many profiles manually
  • Increase staffing accuracy: Project workers can directly maintain their forecasts based on when they are needed for a project
  • Increase time-booking quality: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Timesheet worklist includes projects on which person is staffed
  • Single source of truth: the close integration between resource management information with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Project data provides synchronized data
  • SAP unified User Experience
  • Simple to adapt 

 

Basic scenarios and concepts:

SAP Project and Resource Management is a SaaS offering on SAP Business Technology Platform. Once the subscription is in place a scope item facilitates the setup.

Users can choose if resource management apps for business users should directly run in the SAP Cloud ERP Launchpad, e.g. Project Managers using the Project-related apps can also directly see the resource management apps they need.

 

Setup:

To proceed with the setup the following sources contain more details.
Administration Guide:
https://help.sap.com/docs/PPRM_OD/542f4545bc9d4ecd80bc3a0a6913a735/434f2ec669444cc98583a1c4eadca05a.html

The blog “Setup Resource Management Capability in SAP Project and Resource Management” provides a summary how to proceed by setting up the integration:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/setup-resource-management-capability-in-sap-projects-and-resource/ba-p/13999829

 

Process:

Harmonizing staffing with project setup and milestone planning can reduce Backoffice efforts and allow people to focus on what is needed to deliver projects successfully instead of spending effort in maintaining consistent information across different sources.  

The process starts in SAP Cloud ERP when a Resource demand is created:

 


Screen shows the resource demand defined in the Enterprise Project

Once the Enterprise Project Integration is setup for SAP Cloud ERP “human resource” demands create the Resource Requests in Resource Management.

The process is explained along the most used apps in this blog.

1. Manage Resource Requests (Role: Project Manager)

Resource Request contains the need for a specific resource and is normally being refined by a user, e.g. Project Manager. During the refinement information about needed skills, scope description, requested resource organization are added. Once the request is complete the Project Manager can “publish” the request, so it becomes visible to the Resource Managers. No need to send additional information via email and capture the information directly where it is needed.


Screen shows the resource request which was published and includes “SAP Cloud ERP” as a required skill

 

2. Staff Resource Requests (Role: Resource Manager)

Resource Managers review the request and start now with the search of candidates. Availability and Skill matching are performed and available candidates identified. Resource Manager can propose or directly staff one or multiple candidates:

  • Proposing a candidate, allows Project Manager to accept / decline candidates
  • Soft booking is not yet confirmed staffing and only visible in resource management, while Hard booking is a confirmed booking type and people will see staffing in the SAP Cloud ERP timesheet app.
  • Forward requests, in case no suitable candidates are identified a request can be forwarded to another organization

Learn more how the AI-Assisted Advanced Skill Matching facilitates the search of skilled candidates check:
Unlock Efficient Resource Management with AI in SA... - SAP Community


Screen shows the matching candidates list and the Advanced Skill Match for Lilian Blair – Lilian is being assigned by using the “Quick Assign” feature

 

3. Manage Resource Utilization (Role: Resource Manager)

Provides transparency how people are utilized, visualizes conflicts of over / under bookings and shows directly on which projects and roles people are working.

Resource Managers can also create, change and move assignments in order to resolve conflicts and adjust the planning.


Screen shows a list of filtered employees which includes Lilian Blair and her staffing for the Project Expert role

 

4. My Assignments (Role: Project Team Member)

Once employees are staffed and have the needed authorization, they can maintain a staffing forecast means they can adjust in which weeks they work how many hours on a project. This allows them to refine and balance between different project assignments and align their involvement along with the planned project milestones, considering planned absences etc.

The updated information is afterwards visible for Resource- and Project Managers to ensure everyone has the updated information.



Screen shows mobile view of Lilian’s “My Assignment” app.

Staffed hours and candidates will be visible in SAP Cloud ERP. The Enterprise Project demand will get directly information about the assigned people and hours. This helps to bring up staffing information in the employee’s timesheet worklist to simplify timesheet capturing and reduce the time to find the right project.

 

Summary:

Resources assignments and staffed hours are kept in synch between the SAP Cloud ERP and Resource Management, which ensures that all users have the same view on resource demands and what is being staffed.

SAP Project and Resource Management supports you by gaining transparency on your resource utilization situation with a fully integrated and embedded into the SAP User Experience scenario.

To learn more and to explore Resource Management in SAP Project and Resource Management you can find more information and access the free trial under:

https://www.sap.com/prm

 

Companies running Customer Projects in SAP Cloud ERP can also consult the following blog:
https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/overcoming-challenges-in-staffing-customer-projects-with-sap-project-and/ba-p/13748436

entry.title: API Consumption - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition
entry.content:
With the evolving SAP landscape and customers moving to S/4 HANA Cloud , our prime focus as a consultant is to follow a clean core approach.

SAP Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) is one such platform which helps us in discovering standard APIs,Events, Extensibility options

which we can consume in our S/4 HANA landscape to achieve end-to-end business functionality. This blog focusses mainly on the API consumption from

SAP Business Accelerator HUB and how it differs between the two of the S/4 HANA Cloud offerings - S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition and S/4 HANA Cloud,Private Edition.

We will first go through some of the basic differences and then focus on technically how we can use or consume these APIs in each of the environments.

 

S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

Where to find?

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile -

 

Ready to use APIs available in Business Accelerator Hub(https://api.sap.com/) to be explored under the Tile –

 

Activation

 

Communication management based API Activation. APIs are part of a standard communication scenario. Communication scenario can be found from SAP Business Accelerator HUB as below –

 

 

SICF based API activation(OData V2)For OData V4 no specific activation is needed but the Service Group needs to be published. Not associated to any communication scenario.

 

 

Sandbox availability

“TryOut” option available in SAP Business Accelerator HUB for OData APIs to execute the CRUD methods with Sandbox data. Also you can deploy your own system to do tryout with your actual data of your S/4 HANA Cloud,Public Edition system.

 

 

 

No Tryout option available with any Sandbox. Also here the S/4 HANA system is in a private network and often there will be a Cloud Connector in between so TryOut options have been restricted for APIs for Private Edition

 

 


 

 

 

Consumption

API is consumed through a communication arrangement which is based on a standard communication scenario. Standard Fiori Application -   Communication Arrangements to be used for consumption.

For OData V2 API is activated through transaction code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE.

For OData V4 API no separates activation is required but service group needs to be published through transaction code - /n/IWFND/V4_ADMIN

Practice Guide

We will be using OData V2 - API - API_PRODUCT_SRV as an example to demonstrate the activation of the API in S/4 HANA Public Cloud and S/4 HANA Private Cloud.

API Link for Public Edition – https://api.sap.com/api/API_PRODUCT_SRV/overview

API Link for Private Edition - https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview

 

Scenario 1# Activating API in Public Cloud –

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview  for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with “Product” and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API and is “Active”  for usage.

 

From SAP Business Accelerator HUB you will get the SAP standard communication scenario for the API –

 

Here we will be creating arrangement for communication scenario – SAP_COM_009

Next create a communication user from the Fiori application “Create Communication User”.

 

Give a Username and you can use the “Propose Password” option or you can add your own password.

 

Next step is to create a communication system from the Fiori application “Communication Systems”

 

Click on “New” and provide a System ID and System Name –

 

 

Go to tab “Users for Inbound Communication” and assign the user you just created in the previous step using “Create Communication Users”.

 

 

For the ease of use you can check the checkbox “Inbound Only” which means you are not expecting any outbound communication (S/4HANA -> External) through this communication system and so you will not be asked to enter any user for Outbound communication user for this communication system.

Save the communication system.

Next step is to create the communication arrangement. Go to application “Communication Arrangements”

 

Click on “New”

In the following tab enter “SAP_COM_0009” as the standard communication scenario for API_PRODUCT_SRV.

 

Select the ‘Communication System'(from value help) which we have just created in the previous step. The assigned Communication User will now automatically appear in User Name field.

 

Click “Save” and it will activate your communication arrangement.

You can get your actual service URL for all Inbound Services associated, under the tab “Inbound Services” under the column “Service URL/Service Interface”.

Similarly all the Outbound services associated with this communication Scenario “SAP_COM_0009” will show under the tab “Outbound Services”.Outbound services are generally either SOAP Outbound services or IDOCs.

 

 

All the services that belong to the communication scenario “SAP_COM_0009” will be listed here under the tab “Inbound Service”.

Get the URL where the Service says “Product Master(A2X)” / OData V2”

 

The API link looks like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV

So this makes your API ready for consumption from the external system.

Get the service URL and test it from POSTMAN using the communication user that you created in the first step. In POSTMAN you can use it for Basic Authentication under Authorization.

You can call this URL from SAP Integration Suite using a OData V2 Adapter with basic authentication with the user you created in “Communication User” application.

Note – For Public cloud the way of activating a OData V2 service and OData V4 service are same unlike Private Cloud where there is a difference.

So for OData V4 the API will be also activated by a communication arrangement only as shown above and the URL will look like this - https://<host>/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0002/

Link to API Hub for the OData V4 API of Product Master - https://api.sap.com/api/CE_PRODUCT_0002/overview

 

Scenario 2# Activating API in Private Cloud –

First step same as Public cloud to find the API from https://api.sap.com/ .

Navigate to the link https://api.sap.com/api/OP_API_PRODUCT_SRV_0001/overview for the API or you can search the API as below.

In https://api.sap.com/ go to the tile SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition

 

Under APIs go to ODATA V2 and search with “Product master” and open the one Product Master(A2X) which say ODATA V2 API.

 

 

Next Run Transaction Code - /n/IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE

Click on “Add Service”

entry.title: Why the Future of SAP Consulting Delivery Is More Human
entry.content:
For years, SAP Consulting delivery has been seen as a technical and structured exercise: timelines, modules, go-lives, KPIs. But that view is no longer enough. The projects that fail today do not fail because of technical errors, they fail due to a lack of connection, empathy, and emotional leadership.
Success in consulting delivery is no longer just about what is delivered, but how people experience it, those who execute it and those who receive it.
In the context of S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition implementations, where speed, standardization, fit-to-standard and early adoption are essential, the human component becomes even more critical. The agility that this model demands cannot be achieved by technology alone, it requires teams and leaders who can manage uncertainty, enable rapid change, and support users through their adaptation journey to cloud technology.
Cloud-based projects require clear communication, empathetic leadership, and strong emotional management to ensure that transformation is not only implemented but successfully adopted and embraced. In this environment, emotional intelligence and executive coaching are not “nice to haves”—they are core skills to maximize delivery value.
In my role as a Senior SAP ERP Cloud Consultant, specialized in Finance (Management Accounting, Asset Accounting, Budget Control, and Financial Projects), I have led complex projects across Latin America.
I am also an Executive Coach in Emotional Intelligence and Neuro Linguistic Programming and I’ve seen first-hand that when we apply human tools to delivery:
•  Teams perform better, with less burnout.
•  Clients feel understood, not managed.
•  Trust becomes a competitive advantage.

The SAP Consulting delivery of the future will be:
•  Technical + Human
•  Structurally rigorous + Emotionally intelligent
•  Process-based + People-powered

If we want more agile organizations, more strategic consultants, and more engaged clients, we need leaders who listen, support, connect, and communicate with humanity.
Because the system we implement matters.
But the system we are as people, is what truly transforms.
And you? Are you leading in a more human way?

entry.title: Accelerating Implementation with SAP Activate in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Readers, 

Today we will discuss about accelerating SAP implementations using SAP Activate methodology in the Public Cloud. 

SAP implementation has been going on for over a year, the budget is as well goes to high, and you're still not sure when you'll go live, sometimes I've seen projects gets drag, teams getting frustrated, and businesses losing patience.  

Due to these challenges companies are going with Public cloud implementation as implementation has been completed in less time compared to S/4HANA implementation, with the help of SAP Activate methodology. 

 What is SAP Activate? 

SAP Activate is step-by-step guide from SAP that helps companies quickly and efficiently set up and start using SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. 

It provides a clear guided methodology to deploy, adopt and extend new capabilities across your organization. Start fast, build smart, and run simple, while continuously innovating with SAP Activate. 

Public Cloud + SAP Activate = Game Changer. 

SAP Activate breaks every task into Six easy-to-understand phases: 

  • Discover Phase 
  • Prepare Phase 
  • Explore Phase 
  • Realize Phase 
  • Deploy Phase 
  • Run 

Real time experience: 

Let me walk you through our recent project to show you how this works in practice. 

Week 1-2: Discover Phase 

What we consultant did: Met with business users to understand their business needs. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built questionnaires as no miss on any important things. 

Time saved: Instead of creating requirements from scratch, we used proven templates. 

 Week 3-4: Prepare Phase 

What we consultant did: Got our system ready and planned the project.  

Advantage of Activate: Step-by-step setup guides and automatic system configuration. 

Time saved: No technical setup delays. 

 Week 5-8: Explore Phase 

What we consultant did: Designed our business processes using workshops. 

Advantage of Activate: "Fit-to-Standard" workshops with pre-configured demos. 

Time saved: Instead of explaining concepts, we showed working examples. 

 Week 9-14: Realize Phase 

What we consultant did: Built and tested our solution. 

Advantage of Activate: Migration tools, test scripts, and training templates already ready. 

Time saved: No custom development needed as we used 95% standard functionality. 

 Week 15-16: Deploy Phase &Run 

What we consultant did: Go-Live and started support to users. 

Advantage of Activate: Pre-built support processes and go-live checklists. 

Time saved: Smooth go-live with minimal issues. 

Why Public Cloud makes everything faster? 

  • As we combine public cloud with Activate it makes things faster, below are the points why it makes faster compared to S/4Hana. 
  • No infrastructure setup is required to implement. 
  • Automatic updates as you get new features every three months without any work. 
  • Preconfigured system as about 70 to 80 % of your setup is already done. 
  • Industry standard processes are already built in. 
  • Faster testing of scenarios. 
  • By leveraging the pre-delivered content, customers can jump-start the build using pre-built solutions as well as engineered services. With that, the SAP Activate framework provides a significant reduction in project time, reducing the Total Cost of Implementation (TCI) and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO). 

List of tools that accelerates the project: 

  • Fit-to-Standard workshop as it shows how the standard SAP processes work. 
  • Starter System it gives you a pre-configured system with sample master data to play with as user can use before they buy. 
  • Migration Cockpit it migrates data in days instead of months. 
  • Quality Gates is used to checkpoints make sure that everything is on track, Catches the problems early when they're easy to fix. 

 Conclusion:  By combining SAP Activate with the Public Cloud, companies can implement SAP solutions faster, smarter, and with less stress. The clear project phases, ready-to-use tools, and preconfigured processes help avoid delays, reduce costs, and deliver quick results. 

SAP Activate in the Public Cloud, you're not just implementing software, you're accelerating business transformation.

entry.title: Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的核心功能与应用
entry.content:
在快速变化的商业环境中，效率和智能化是企业成功的关键。SAP的智能副驾驶Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中扮演重要角色，旨在通过自然语言交互帮助用户高效完成任务、获取信息和管理业务对象。本文将深入探讨Joule的关键功能及其应用场景。

Joule不仅是聊天机器人，更是能理解用户意图、协助完成复杂业务流程的智能助手。其核心能力分为五类：信息查询、应用导航，事务处理，分析功能以及代理功能。

 

以下将为您深入介绍Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的主要功能及其核心应用场景：

 

​​• 导航功能 (Navigational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule帮助用户定位与任务最相关的应用程序。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 用户可通过描述需执行任务或查找对象向Joule提出请求。Joule提供导航至常用应用程序的建议。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “我在哪个应用中可以创建采购订单？”
    • “如何上传供应商发票？”
    • “查找用于分析日记账分录的应用”
    • “在哪里可以为物料AB0123创建采购订单？”
    • “显示用于定义‘咨询’活动的成本率的应用”
  • ​​前提条件​​: 访问Joule建议的应用需用户拥有相应的业务目录权限。

​​• 信息功能 (Informational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule通过分析总结SAP帮助门户信息，提供简洁、有依据的问题答案。其评估问题，检索相关文章，利用大型语言模型分析并总结结果，提供相关文章链接。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 对话中获取关于应用程序、产品功能等查询的有依据回复。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “什么是免费销售订单？”
    • “服务订单和服务合同之间有什么区别？”
    • “如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”
  • ​​额外功能​​: Joule可引导用户至相关应用或在需要时代为执行操作。

​​• 事务处理功能 (Transactional Capabilities)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule使您能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务。您可以在对话中直接查看和处理业务对象，而无需离开对话界面并执行操作，从而简化工作流程并减少获取洞察所需的时间。

                  

  • 应用场景
    • 查看业务数据 (Viewing Business Data)​​:
      • 无需打开相关应用，您可以在Joule聊天窗口中直接显示业务对象详细数据,比如要求Joule显示如采购订单状态、采购申请项目等详细信息。
      • 目前该模式已支持采购订单、销售订单、供应商发票、检验方法、主检验特性、流程订单等共计34类业务对象（完整列表详见帮助文档）
      • 示例问题：
      • 显示逾期采购订单项
      • 显示尚未交货的销售订单​
      • 获取计划开始日期为2026年的生产订单
      • 获取我创建的生产订单确认

 

    • ​​创建洞察卡 (Creating Insights Cards)​​:
      • 该功能支持您在Joule输入查询后，显示列表和洞察的快照，用户满意可将卡片添加至“我的主页”
      • 支持的应用示例有：供应商发票列表（版本2）、管理采购订单（版本2）、管理销售订单、维护物料清单、查找维护订单、管理采购申请等。

 

    • 财务领域：创建固定资产主数据 (Creating Fixed Asset Master Data)​​:
  • 该功能支持您在Joule内创建固定资产主数据记录。
  • 您可以要求Joule创建单个资产主记录，并提供公司代码、成本中心、资产类别及可选资产描述。当信息不全时，Joule会引导创建过程，请求补充信息。
  • 示例对话：
    • 用户：“请创建一个固定资产”
    • Joule: 请提供以下信息公司代码（Company Code）,资产类别（Asset Class）,成本中心（Cost Center）资产描述（Asset Description）
    • 用户提供详情如“1010, 3200, 10101041, 笔记本电脑ABC”。

 

 

  • ​​销售领域：检查和续订即将到期的价格 (Renew Expiring Prices)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助您管理即将到期的价格（存储为销售定价条件记录），您可以要求Joule查询即将到期价格，按日期/时间范围过滤。可延长有效期至新日期或延长一段时间（如30天、一周、三个季度或一年），也可按百分比调整条件金额或比率。
    • 示例请求：“显示2025年5月1日到期的PPR0和PCP0条件类型的价格”、“延长有效日期一个月并调整条件金额-10%”

 

  • ​​销售订单状态检查 (Sales Order Status Check)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助销售代表或经理检查销售订单履行状态，识别阻碍问题。如存在问题，Joule可显示问题数量、最早到期日、可能原因、处理建议等，并可打开相关销售订单应用。
    • 示例请求：“销售订单12345的状态是什么？”、“销售订单12345有什么问题吗？”

 

  • 代理能力 (Agentic Capabilities)
    • 作用：Joule能够自主地与环境互动，并通过多步任务迭代推理以实现目标，具备规划、反思、工具使用以及协作和多代理等关键能力。您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看代理功能的具体落地日期。
  • 分析能力 (Analytical Capabilities)
    • Joule也将在未来版本中提供基于业务数据的分析能力，能够为用户提供见解。这部分的功能尚在开发中，您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看有关分析功能的最新信息。

​​Joule的技术架构与访问要求​​


Joule作为独立软件组件，通过 ​​SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)​​ 以 ​​SaaS（软件即服务）​​ 形式管理和更新，支持集中式设置，实现跨连接应用的统一用户体验。

​​许可和授权：要访问SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的Joule，可能需要额外的许可和授权。建议咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取更多信息。

业务目录要求：为了能够访问Joule提议的应用程序或使用其特定功能，您的用户需要被分配相应的业务目录（business catalogs）。

 

Joule的未来与扩展性

Joule目前支持以11种语言显示工作内容，未来还将支持更多语言。

 Joule还具备强大的可扩展性，允许通过自定义技能、低代码平台和第三方连接进行扩展。Joule studio在SAP Build中提供，助力您根据特定需求扩展Joule的功能。

更值得一提的是，Joule的AI辅助文档接地 (Document Grounding)功能，能够结合推理能力，利用您自己的非结构化或半结构化文档（如HR政策文档）来回答用户问题。它通过将大型语言模型 (LLM) 与高级信息检索相结合，增强响应质量和准确性，最大程度地减少“幻觉”，并建立信任、减少歧义。

Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中，不仅仅是一个工具，更是一个智能化的业务搭档。它将繁琐的导航、信息查找和部分事务处理任务，转化为直观的自然语言对话，极大地提升了用户体验和工作效率。

感谢阅读。
